A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Couch Potato Critic Review (spoiler free)
STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI

I am understanding why the fan score for The Last Jedi is a lowly 58 on rotten Tomatoes.

I was utterly frustrated by some of the things Rian did. He constantly interrupted the actual story to go off on these little plot vignettes\, including the ending\, which felt more like a not right for Star Wars Marvel bonus ending\, or like the Mean Joe Green Coke ad from the 70's. I was sitting there asking myself\, "What the fuck was that? Did someone splice that in as a joke?" I am not spoiling it by saying that\, as every film has a fucking ending\, and I am as ambiguous as I can be. 
My whole problem is this\, the film's story and ending felt disjointed and anticlimactic.

I now get some of Mark Hamill's warnings and comments.

Excluding the prequels\, I haven't disliked a Luke Skywalker related Star Wars film this much since 1983. Like Return of the Jedi\, this film is chock full of bad ideas and weak storytelling. I will be reviewing it more thoroughly later\, after my second viewing tonight. I am hoping seeing it again\, will change my feelings. Doubt it\, but\, well\, I love Star Wars and feel I need to try.

Look\, Like Return of the Jedi\, it was still a fun film\, but\, it was completely sub-par to what the critics are raving about\, making me ask\, "Did IQs just drop sharply while I was away?"

The Last Jedi gets just 3 out of 5 potatoes.
